content.question: Which of the following best describes the effect of temperature on corals’ ability to produce <math alttext="D M S P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DMSP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> as shown in Figure 1?

choices.label: Both juvenile and adult corals produce less <math alttext="D M S P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DMSP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="27 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>27</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> than at <math alttext="32 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Both juvenile and adult corals produce less <math alttext="D M S P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DMSP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="32 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> than at <math alttext="27 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>27</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The amount of <math alttext="D M S P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DMSP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> produced over time increases at <math alttext="32 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in juveniles only.

The amount of <math alttext="D M S P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DMSP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> produced over time increases at <math alttext="32 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in adults only.

content.answer: Both juvenile and adult corals produce less <math alttext="D M S P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DMSP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="27 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>27</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> than at <math alttext="32 degrees Celsius " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>32</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 4.B: Describe data from a table or graph, including: i. identifying specific data points ii. describing trends and patterns in the data iii. describing relationships between variables
